xxl.core.io
Class BufferedRandomAccessFile

java.lang.Object
  java.io.RandomAccessFile
      xxl.core.io.BufferedRandomAccessFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, DataInput, DataOutput
public class BufferedRandomAccessFile
extends RandomAccessFile

This class provides a buffered random access file that reads and writes whole blocks of buffered bytes to and from the random access file. When reading bytes from the file, the buffer is checked first, whether it contains the desired bytes. When the desired bytes are not buffered, whole blocks containing the desired bytes are read into the buffer. When writing bytes to the file, the bytes are written to the buffered blocks (that are read from the file into the buffer when needed). So every read and write operation works actually on the buffer and does only access the file, when the desired bytes are not buffered. Every time a block is flushed out of the buffer, the according bytes in the random access file are updated.

Example usage (1). 

     // catch IOExceptions

     try {

         // create a new buffered random access file with ...

         BufferedRandomAccessFile file = new BufferedRandomAccessFile(

             // a new file

             new File("file.dat"),

             // read and write access

             "rw",

             // an LRU buffer with 5 slots

             new LRUBuffer(5),

             // a block size of 20 bytes

             20
         ); 

         // write data to the data output stream

         file.writeInt(200);
         file.writeUTF("Some data!");
         file.writeUTF("More data!");
         file.writeBoolean(true);
         file.writeUTF("Another bundle of data!");
         file.writeUTF("The last bundle of data!");

         // set the file pointer to the first string

         file.seek(4);

         // print the data of the data input stream

         System.out.println(file.readUTF());
         System.out.println(file.readUTF());
         System.out.println(file.readBoolean());
         System.out.println(file.readUTF());
         System.out.println(file.readUTF());

         // set the file pointer to the beginning of the file

         file.seek(0);

         // print the first integer

         System.out.println(file.readInt());

         // close the open streams

         file.close();
     }
     catch (IOException ioe) {
         System.out.println("An I/O error occured.");
     }

See Also:
File, Function, IOException, RandomAccessFile, WrappingRuntimeException

Field Detail

buffer

protected Buffer buffer
The buffer that is used for storing the blocks of buffered bytes.

blockSize

protected int blockSize
The size of the blocks that are used for storing the buffered bytes of this random access file. In other words, every block can be used for buffering blockSize bytes of this random access file.

filePointer

protected long filePointer
The file pointer is a kind of cursor, or index into the random access file; input operations read bytes starting at the file pointer and advance the file pointer past the bytes read. If the random access file is in read/write mode, output operations write bytes starting at the file pointer and advance the file pointer past the bytes written.

length

protected long length
The length of the buffered random access file.

block

protected byte[] block
The block of buffered bytes that is accessed at last. This byte array contains the bytes of the random access file that are read or written at last.

blockId

protected long blockId
The id of the actual block in the buffer. The blockId is determined by the offset of the block's bytes in the random access file and blockSize, i.e. the first blockSize bytes of the file will be buffered in the block with blockId 0, the next blockSize bytes int hte block with blockSize 1 and so on.

counter

public final IOCounter counter
A simple counter for counting I/Os. It is increased every time a block is read from the file into the buffer or the other way round. It can be used for comparing the efficiency of buffered and unbuffered files or of buffers with different displacement strategies.

Constructor Detail

BufferedRandomAccessFile

public BufferedRandomAccessFile(File file,
                                String mode,
                                Buffer buffer,
                                int blockSize)
                         throws IOException
Constructs a new buffered random access file stream to read from, and optionally to write to, the file specified by the File argument.
The mode argument must either be equal to "r" or "rw", indicating that the file is to be opened for input only or for both input and output, respectively. The write methods on this object will always throw an IOException if the file is opened with a mode of "r". If the mode is "rw" and the file does not exist, then an attempt is made to create it. An IOException is thrown if the file argument refers to a directory.
The specified buffer is used for buffering the bytes of the random access file. The buffered bytes are stored in blocks with the specified size.
This constructor is equivalent to th call of BufferedRandomAccessFile(file, mode, buffer, blockSize, new IOCounter()).

Parameters:
file - the file object.
mode - the access mode.
buffer - the buffer that is used for buffering the file.
blockSize - the size of a block of buffered bytes.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the mode argument is not equal to "r" or to "rw".
FileNotFoundException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, or cannot be opened or created for any other reason.
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file or the mode is "rw" and the security manager's checkWrite method denies write access to the file.

BufferedRandomAccessFile

public BufferedRandomAccessFile(String name,
                                String mode,
                                Buffer buffer,
                                int blockSize)
                         throws IOException
Creates a random access file stream to read from, and optionally to write to, a file with the specified name.
The mode argument must either be equal to "r" or "rw", indicating that the file is to be opened for input only or for both input and output, respectively. The write methods on this object will always throw an IOException if the file is opened with a mode of "r". If the mode is "rw" and the file does not exist, then an attempt is made to create it. An IOException is thrown if the name argument refers to a directory.
The specified buffer is used for buffering the bytes of the random access file. The buffered bytes are stored in blocks with the specified size.

Parameters:
name - the system-dependent filename.
mode - the access mode.
buffer - the buffer that is used for buffering the file.
blockSize - the size of a block of buffered bytes.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the mode argument is not equal to "r" or to "rw".
FileNotFoundException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, or cannot be opened or created for any other reason.
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file or the mode is "rw" and the security manager's checkWrite method denies write access to the file.

BufferedRandomAccessFile

public BufferedRandomAccessFile(File file,
                                String mode,
                                Buffer buffer,
                                int blockSize,
                                IOCounter counter)
                         throws IOException
Constructs a new buffered random access file stream to read from, and optionally to write to, the file specified by the File argument.
The mode argument must either be equal to "r" or "rw", indicating that the file is to be opened for input only or for both input and output, respectively. The write methods on this object will always throw an IOException if the file is opened with a mode of "r". If the mode is "rw" and the file does not exist, then an attempt is made to create it. An IOException is thrown if the file argument refers to a directory.
The specified buffer is used for buffering the bytes of the random access file. The buffered bytes are stored in blocks with the specified size. The specified I/O counter will be continued in order to count the I/Os caused by the buffered random access file.

Parameters:
file - the file object.
mode - the access mode.
buffer - the buffer that is used for buffering the file.
blockSize - the size of a block of buffered bytes.
counter - an I/O counter to be continued.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the mode argument is not equal to "r" or to "rw".
FileNotFoundException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, or cannot be opened or created for any other reason.
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file or the mode is "rw" and the security manager's checkWrite method denies write access to the file.

BufferedRandomAccessFile

public BufferedRandomAccessFile(String name,
                                String mode,
                                Buffer buffer,
                                int blockSize,
                                IOCounter counter)
                         throws IOException
Creates a random access file stream to read from, and optionally to write to, a file with the specified name.
The mode argument must either be equal to "r" or "rw", indicating that the file is to be opened for input only or for both input and output, respectively. The write methods on this object will always throw an IOException if the file is opened with a mode of "r". If the mode is "rw" and the file does not exist, then an attempt is made to create it. An IOException is thrown if the name argument refers to a directory.
The specified buffer is used for buffering the bytes of the random access file. The buffered bytes are stored in blocks with the specified size. The specified I/O counter will be continued in order to count the I/Os caused by the buffered random access file.

Parameters:
name - the system-dependent filename.
mode - the access mode.
buffer - the buffer that is used for buffering the file.
blockSize - the size of a block of buffered bytes.
counter - an I/O counter to be continued.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the mode argument is not equal to "r" or to "rw".
FileNotFoundException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, or cannot be opened or created for any other reason.
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file or the mode is "rw" and the security manager's checkWrite method denies write access to the file.
Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Closes this buffered random access file stream and releases any system resources associated with the stream. A closed buffered random access file cannot perform input or output operations and cannot be reopened.
This implementation flushes the buffer first. Thereafter all buffered blocks are removed out of the buffer and actual block is set to null. At last the random access file is closed.

Specified by:
close in interface Closeable
Overrides:
close in class RandomAccessFile
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

public long getFilePointer()
                    throws IOException

the offset from the beginning of the file, in bytes, at which the next read or write occurs.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

getBlock

protected void getBlock(boolean readBlock)
                 throws IOException
Sets block to the block of buffered bytes that contains the byte the file pointer points to. When this block is not buffered, the actual block is unfixed and a new block containing the desired bytes is inserted into the buffer.

Parameters:
readBlock - determines whether to read the block from file or just to provide an empty block frame.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

readBlock

protected byte[] readBlock(Object id)
Reads the block of bytes with the given id and returns it. The id and blockSize determines the block of bytes to read. The id 0 identifies the first blockSize bytes of the file, the id 1 identifies the second blockSize bytes and so on. After reading the block of bytes, the I/O counter is increased and the byte array containing this block is returned.

Parameters:
id - The id of the block (type Long).
Returns:
The block as a byte array.

read

public int read(byte[] array,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws IOException
Reads up to len bytes of data from the buffered file into an array of bytes. This method blocks until at least one byte of input is available.
Although BufferedRandomAccessFile is not a subclass of InputStream, this method behaves in the exactly the same way as the InputStream.read(byte[], int, int) method of InputStream.

Overrides:
read in class RandomAccessFile
Parameters:
array - the byte array into which the data is read.
off - the start offset of the data.
len - the maximum number of bytes read.
Returns:
the total number of bytes read into the array, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of the file has been reached.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

read

public int read(byte[] array)
         throws IOException
Reads up to array.length bytes of data from the buffered file into an array of bytes. This method blocks until at least one byte of input is available.
Although BufferedRandomAccessFile is not a subclass of InputStream, this method behaves in the exactly the same way as the InputStream.read(byte[]) method of InputStream.

Overrides:
read in class RandomAccessFile
Parameters:
array - the byte array into which the data is read.
Returns:
the total number of bytes read into the array, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of this file has been reached.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

read

public int read()
         throws IOException
Reads a byte of data from this file. The byte is returned as an int value in the range 0 to 255 (0x00-0x0ff). This method blocks if no input is yet available.
This implementation sets block to the block that contains the desired byte by calling the getBlock method. Thereafter the desired byte is read and returned.
Although BufferedRandomAccessFile is not a subclass of InputStream, this method behaves in exactly the same way as the InputStream.read() method of InputStream.

Overrides:
read in class RandomAccessFile
Returns:
the next byte of data, or -1 if the end of the file has been reached.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs. Not thrown if end-of-file has been reached.

seek

public void seek(long pos)
          throws IOException
Sets the file-pointer offset, measured from the beginning of this file, at which the next read or write occurs. The offset may be set beyond the end of the file. Setting the offset beyond the end of the file does not change the file length. The file length will change only by writing after the offset has been set beyond the end of the file.

Overrides:
seek in class RandomAccessFile
Parameters:
pos - the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the file, at which to set the file pointer.
Throws:
IOException - if pos is less than 0 or if an I/O error occurs.

setLength

public void setLength(long newLength)
               throws IOException
Sets the length of this file.
If the present length of the file as returned by the length method is greater than the newLength argument then the file will be truncated. In this case, if the file offset as returned by the getFilePointer method is greater then newLength then after this method returns the offset will be equal to newLength. Also every block storing only buffered bytes of the truncated part of the file is removed out of the buffer.
If the present length of the file as returned by the length method is smaller than the newLength argument then the file will be extended. In this case, the contents of the extended portion of the file are not defined.

Overrides:
setLength in class RandomAccessFile
Parameters:
newLength - the desired length of the file.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

writeBlock

protected void writeBlock(Object id,
                          Object object)
Overwrites the block of bytes with the given id with the specified object (byte array). The id and blockSize determines the block of bytes to overwrite. The id 0 identifies the first blockSize bytes of the file, the id 1 identifies the second blockSize bytes and so on. After writing the block of bytes, the I/O counter is increased.

Parameters:
id - position inside the file as Long.
object - byte array to be written.

                  int off,

           throws IOException
Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this buffered file.

Specified by:

write

public void write(byte[] array)
           throws IOException
Writes b.length bytes from the specified byte array to this buffered file, starting at the current file pointer.

Specified by:
write in interface DataOutput
Overrides:
write in class RandomAccessFile
Parameters:
array - the data.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

write

public void write(int b)
           throws IOException
Writes the specified byte to this buffered file. The write starts at the current file pointer.
This implementation sets block to the block that contains the desired byte by calling the getBlock method. Thereafter the flush function of the buffered block is updated by a function that writes the block of bytes to the random access file, when it is invoked. At last the desired byte is written to the actual block.

Specified by:
write in interface DataOutput
Overrides:
write in class RandomAccessFile
Parameters:
b - the byte to be written.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a BufferedRandomAccessFile. It can also be used to test the functionality of a BufferedRandomAccessFile.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
